sensory_systems.name: Advanced Digital Twins (Environmental & Infrastructure)
sensory_systems.description: Real-time 3D models of cloud infrastructure, incorporating sensor data to dynamically reflect the physical state, temperature, power consumption, network latency, and resource utilization of each server, rack, and data center. Goes beyond simple monitoring to predict performance bottlenecks and anomalies.
sensors: Network Packet Analyzers (latency, jitter, packet loss)

sensory_systems.name: AI-Powered Anomaly Detection Systems
sensory_systems.description: Utilizes machine learning models trained on historical and real-time data to automatically identify deviations from normal operating conditions, predicting potential failures before they occur.

control_systems.name: Self-Healing Cloud Orchestration
control_systems.description: Autonomous system dynamically adjusting resource allocation, routing traffic, and triggering automated remediation actions based on data from the sensory systems and AI-powered anomaly detection.

control_systems.name: Adaptive Cooling Systems
control_systems.description: Precise control of airflow and liquid cooling based on real-time temperature data and workload demands.
control_systems.control_mechanism: PID Control Loops & Advanced Thermoelectric Cooling

mechanical_systems.name: Modular Data Center Units (DCUs)
mechanical_systems.description: Standardized, self-contained units capable of housing servers, cooling systems, and power distribution. Designed for rapid deployment and scalability.

mechanical_systems.name: Automated Server Deployment & Retrieval Robots
mechanical_systems.description: Robotic systems capable of autonomously moving servers within DCUs, based on load balancing and optimization requirements.

software_integration.name: Cloud Resource Management Platform (CRMP)
software_integration.description: Centralized platform orchestrating all automated processes, providing a single pane of glass for monitoring, control, and optimization.

software_integration.name: Intent-Based Infrastructure Management (IBIM)
software_integration.description: System where users define desired outcomes (e.g., 'maximize performance for database X') and the system autonomously implements the necessary changes.
